    public interface Message
    The Message interface lets you discover the following information about a compiler message. 
     1. getLevel()    - Error level: error, warning or info.
 2. getPath()     - Location.
 3. getLine()     - Line number.
 4. getColumn()   - Column number.
 5. toString()    - Message string.
    The Message.toString() method returns the message text.
    Version:
    2.0.1
    Author:
    Clement Wong

      Indicates that the severity of this Message is "warning".

    • Method Detail

      • getLevel

        String getLevel()
        Returns the compiler message severity level.
        Returns:
        One of Message.ERROR, Message.WARNING, or Message.INFO.
        See Also:
        ERROR, WARNING, INFO

      • getPath

        String getPath()
        Returns the location of the file that contains the error.
        Returns:
        String; null if the path is not applicable.

      • getLine

        int getLine()
        Returns the line number of the file that contains the error.
        Returns:
        An integer; -1 if the line number is not applicable.

      • getColumn

        int getColumn()
        Returns the column number of the file that contains the error.
        Returns:
        An integer; -1 if the column number is not applicable.

        String toString()
        Returns the message.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
